title: How to Make Green Pancakes

steps.headline: Add the buttermilk, egg, oil, and spinach to a blender.
steps.description: Blend well until the mixture is smooth and green in color.

steps.headline: Whisk the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a separate bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking power, baking soda, and salt. Whisk until well combined.

steps.headline: Whisk the wet ingredients in with the dry.
steps.description: Pour the wet ingredients in with the dry and mix well until properly combined.

steps.headline: Heat up an iron skillet or griddle and spread olive oil over it.
Scoop about a tablespoon of pancake batter onto the skillet or griddle.
Cook the pancake on both sides until golden brown.
steps.description: Place it on a large plate.

steps.headline: Repeat until there is no more pancake batter.
Serve.
steps.description: Place a pancake on a serving plate. Garnish it with any desired toppings such as maple syrup, mint, green edible glitter, or Lucky Charms cereal. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Whisk the dry ingredients.
steps.description: In a large bowl, whisk the sugar, cocoa powder, flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt until well combined.

steps.headline: In a separate bowl, beat the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Whisk the sour cream, buttermilk, butter, oil, and eggs.

steps.headline: Pour the wet ingredients in with the dry.
steps.description: Mix well until properly combined and until the pancake batter forms.

steps.headline: Add in the green food coloring gel.
steps.description: Stir until the pancake batter is a vibrant color of green.

steps.headline: Heat up an iron skillet or griddle and spread olive oil over it.
Scoop about a tablespoon of pancake batter onto the skillet or griddle.
Cook the pancake on both sides until golden brown.
steps.description: Place it on a large plate.

steps.headline: Repeat until there is no more pancake batter.
Serve.
steps.description: Place a pancake on a serving plate. Garnish it with any desired toppings such as maple syrup, mint, green edible glitter, or Lucky Charms cereal. Enjoy!

text: Green Spinach Pancakes Add the buttermilk, egg, oil, and spinach to a blender. Blend well until the mixture is smooth and green in color. Whisk the dry ingredients. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking power, baking soda, and salt. Whisk until well combined. Whisk the wet ingredients in with the dry. Pour the wet ingredients in with the dry and mix well until properly combined. Heat up an iron skillet or griddle and spread olive oil over it.  Scoop about a tablespoon of pancake batter onto the skillet or griddle.  Cook the pancake on both sides until golden brown. Place it on a large plate. Repeat until there is no more pancake batter.  Serve. Place a pancake on a serving plate. Garnish it with any desired toppings such as maple syrup, mint, green edible glitter, or Lucky Charms cereal. Enjoy! Green Velvet Pancakes Whisk the dry ingredients. In a large bowl, whisk the sugar, cocoa powder, flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt until well combined. In a separate bowl, beat the wet ingredients. Whisk the sour cream, buttermilk, butter, oil, and eggs. Pour the wet ingredients in with the dry. Mix well until properly combined and until the pancake batter forms. Add in the green food coloring gel. Stir until the pancake batter is a vibrant color of green. Heat up an iron skillet or griddle and spread olive oil over it.  Scoop about a tablespoon of pancake batter onto the skillet or griddle.  Cook the pancake on both sides until golden brown. Place it on a large plate. Repeat until there is no more pancake batter.  Serve. Place a pancake on a serving plate. Garnish it with any desired toppings such as maple syrup, mint, green edible glitter, or Lucky Charms cereal. Enjoy!
